H0.text: Gerascophobia is the persistent fear of doing what. Losing physical strength

H1.text: Gerascophobia is the persistent fear of doing what. Forgetting important memories

H2.text: Gerascophobia is the persistent fear of doing what. Being dependent on others

H3.text: Gerascophobia is the persistent fear of doing what. Growing old/ageing

A4.text: the loss of independence and mobility

A5.text: the decline of physical and mental health

A6.text: Older adults are more prone to social isolation as well, which can further increase the risk for physical and mental conditions such as anxiety, depression, and cognitive decline.

A7.text: About 3% of people between the ages of 65 and 74, 19% of those between 75 and 84, and nearly half of those over 85 years old have dementia.

A9.text: Specific phobias in older adults has been linked with a decrease in quality of life.

A10.text: Those with specific phobias are at an increased risk of suicide.
